metadata.title: CVE-2020-27187 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in KDE Partition Manager 4.1.0 before 4.2.0. Thekpmcore_externalcommand helper contains a logic flaw in which the serviceinvoking D-Bus is not properly checked. An attacker on the local machinecan replace /etc/fstab, and execute mount and other partitioning relatedcommands, while KDE Partition Manager is running. the mount command canthen be used to gain full root privileges.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27187` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libkpmcore12 - 4.2.0-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: kpmcore package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-2').
